[b]Dead Horizon 3/5:[/b] Hra na pět minut. Nikoli na zabavení jednou za čas na pět minut, ale skutečně od spuštění po závěr finálních titulků. Čili spíše hříčka zdarma. I když hříčka... Každopádně (jediným) důvodem proč to přeci jen vzít na milost a (ne)ztratit u toho pět minut života je, že to má kongeniálně elegantně vymyšlenou jednu (resp. v celé hře jedinou) herní mechaniku; a sice tasení koltu během duelu. A je to tak nosné, že by na této mechanice nesporně šel vystavět plnohodnotný westernový indie titul na pomezí rozhodovací textovky a "simulátoru" přestřelek. Tento jím ještě není, ale v budoucnu z toho nápadu možná třeba i něco bude. Možná. Snad.

36147276.review: Очень сложно назвать эту штуку игрой. По сути, это шэсть двухмерных пиксельных картинок, которые сопровождаются текстом. 35767098.review:
For a brief adventure, Dead Horizon offers a well made experience, but the typical point and click gameplay, as suggested in the game's description, is certainly not part of that. It presents a short story with a twitch minigame, which simply grants no time to point and click and read. However, the story that is told and the single gameplay mechanic of quickly drawing and firing a gun in a standoff are interesting enough to warrant a few minutes of entertainment.

Dead Horizon greets the player with distorted chiptune music, seemingly coming right from an '80s PC speaker. Its almost square aspect ratio, use of colours, the beautifully made pixel graphics and the dirty sounds all contribute to a fit and proper retro vibe. The writing is succinct and believable, just right for the size of this game.

The mixture of themes is also quite remarkable, with an obvious Western central theme, a touch of fantasy, some Eastern and incisive steampunk aspects. Through a handful of  pictures and nearly indescriptive text, Dead Horizon manages to start building an intriguing world before abruptly ending and withholding any explanation.

It's definitely worth the time playing, if only for the cool characters and fresh blend of themes.

35735805.review: its really good! for a game that only takes 10 minutes at the absolute longest, it holds some interesting ideas. the music and aesthetic all fit together in a way that really fits, and is clearly well thought out. for a "point and click" type of game it takes that in a way that I didn't actually expect, but really like! it's unique and refreshing especially when I for one wasn't enthused about going into a 10 minute game expecting to have to point and click my way through 10 minute exploration. it actually does that with a lot of my expectations, and i really really like this game! it's good. it's enjoyable. i like it. and it's not really what you expect from a game.

35627818.review:
Short, sweet, and just about perfect in every way. Cute pixel art, evocative themes, and fantastic writing make this game a "must-have" little gem, and getting it for free is just the icing on the cake.

 I found myself wanting to experience so much more of this world; to learn the stories behind all the characters' lives. It's highly impressive that a 10-15 min game could make me care so much, but that is just the essence of the wonderful storytelling in this game. Be sure to read through the gunslinger's book in the Menu for another great story.

 I highly recommend this game, especially if you like games with good stories, and, after all, the game is short and free, so nothing will be wasted if it's not up your alley.

35424921.review:
[b][u]5 Things You Should Know about [i]Dead Horizon[/i][/u][/b]
[b]What's Is It?[/b]
A short little Weird West shooting gallery game.  Highly thematic, retro pixel graphics and matching audio.  VERY short (~10 minutes) but also very enjoyable for the duration.  Ending theme music is pretty good too.

[b]What's The Best Part?[/b]
The mechanic for drawing your gun before firing is neat.  Simple but effective.  This is the sort of good game design that really immerses you in a game's theme without you even really noticing it.  Also neat: that the game reminds you to put your gun away again after your opponent is dead.

[b]What's The Worst Part?[/b]
Nothing, really.  With a game this small, there's really not a lot to critique.  You either like it or you don't, and I liked it.

Some people have been putting up "it's too short" as a negative, but I'm not so sure about that one, myself.  The game is great just the way it is, but I suspect it would get boring [i]really fast[/i] if it were significantly longer (and had nothing else different.)  In other words, a longer game would also require more depth, both of story and of game mechanics, to keep things interesting.  This one hit the sweet spot just the way it is.

[b]Will I Like It?[/b]
Hard to say, but it won't take long to find out for yourself.  Plus, it's free!

[b]Why Should I Buy It?[/b]
It's quick and stylish.  There are certainly worse ways to kill 10 minutes.

This has been a 5TYSK review. (#0014)

34514589.review:
Dead Horizon has the interesting style for point and click and storytelling but it is weakened by the exteremely short duration of the game. 

Story: Dead Hoizion tells the story of a women who during the game gains a deadly repuation for her duels and how and who many she killed. What i liked from this is that it doesn't show the glory of winning in duels and being a feared shooter. As an example, in the story, the main charcter would tell about the townfolk heard of her would either want to buy drinks for her and tell story of her battles but also different folks would fear her becuase of her high skills in duels. Surpirisingly, the story is quite set grounded in the way of the real wild west even though it is inspired heavily of Spaghetti westerns as the character first duel with a man is becuase of something trvial such as gambling cards which happens quite a lot to the real historical west.The game also delves into topics of death, life and the interesting meaning from all of this. But sadly there are problems in the story, which firstly is the problem of the main charcter herself. Before i say this, i know the devs are intenional for not giving much focus on the person rather her expolits in duels and it affect her life. But the problem is that the story is told so brief with so little detail that it is hard to fully understand the emtional turmoil of the character and the player doesn't know much about her to begin with to the point that i forgot something basic as her name becuase the dialogue only say it only twice or three times in the entire game. While it is well written, the pacing of it is all over the place and feel incomplete rather than simple short and sweet.

Gameplay: The gamplay is a first person point and click in the most basic of terms. The game is broken up to stationy section where there only one control which is the mouse and the player can click to interact with the enviroment to only read information from this. But there is another mechanic that is all focused on is the shooting. The closest i can compare is arcade shooters such as Time Crisis and House of the Dead but you can only shoot once to kill the opponent. This can be used by simply moving the mouse down the screen to equip it. It simple, but effective and easy to understand for all people which is fine for me. For 4 of the 5 sections of the game is focued on the duels and the enamies throughout will test your refelxes similar to duels in Red Dead Redemption but without the dead eye. Sadly there are no ways to change the outcome of the duels as no matter where you shot on the enemy, he will die in on hit beside missing and dying. It's a shame as it could be cool to shoot the arm of a person to drop their weapon or talk them out of it. 

Presentation: The Game presentaion is set in pixel art and sound effects and music are in chip-tune clearly to be a throw-back to 16bit genertaion of the Super Nintendo and Sega Mega Drive/ Genesis. While i am assured some people would eb groaning at this becuase of the large amoult of saturation of this on steam for years. But i don't mind at this usually, as this actually in my opinion works well esspecially the well done music that add a tense but gritty atmosphere. 

Conculsion: Dead Horizon has it's faults that in any other narative-focused game would be lethal but for this game, it doesn't dectract the experience too much as the main core theme are still able to be expressed and the simplisitic gameplay isn't bogged down on unnessary mechinics and design like other games. Being the game is free and can be beaten in a few minutes, i suggest you should at least try.

34498264.review:
I really enjoyed this. Lots of fun food for thought. Definitely read the lore book in the menu. It's really well written and adds a lot to the story. 
I also noticed how a lot of the reviewers are mentioning that they wish the game gave the player the choice not to shoot/kill. I think it's kind of cool how the fact that the choice wasn't there just emphasized a desire not to shoot. Just more food for thought. I appreciated the lack of choice in this case. 
Anyway, play it, it's awesome.

34452687.review: Short, sweet - at least as sweet as a game about murder can be - and atmospheric. Great pixel art backed with good writing and music. The gunslinging mechanic is simple and fairly intuitive. Don't go into it expecting a lot of depth and you'l be rewarded with a game you actually want to finish.

34437212.review:
Dead Horizon is like a short, sweet ride through a western film as you play as the infamous gunslinger, Bonnie Starr. While there is some gameplay here with you having to shoot multiple people in a quickdraw with your mouse and while that aspect of the gameplay is fun and done well, the writing is what makes Dead Horizon great. While Bonnie herself has no shown dialogue, the narration of her life helps to develop her and really draws you into the world of Dead Horizon and helps you sympathize her place in the world. 

While the gameplay is incredibly simple, gunning down anyone dumb enough to cross your way is really saitsfying as the shooting is accompanied by a great sound design and detailed animations of your opponents going down. You can even inspect various parts of each screen too if you want to see more of the excellent writing that the game offers. However, there's not much variety in the gameplay as all you do is just shoot people but that's not much of a fault at all considering how short the game is (like less than an hour).

Overall, Dead Horizon is a really, really good short game and you really have no excuse not to play it since its free and all. Hope you enjoyed my 300 word essay on this excellent game

The gameplay is simple, the story moves comfortably forward and the character designs are unique.  It's actually quite incredible just how well-realized this world is and it's one I'd like to revisit someday.  Kudos to 14 Hours.

34281018.review:
This game was a surprisingly fun experience. The writing was fun and engaging, and there was a good amount of replayability to find all the little things you might miss the first time through. I had different messages that appeared for some fights for example, and it's not possible to get all the dialogue messages in a few scenes in the first run through. The game can be completed in 10 minutes on a blind playthrough, but it's a great experience that I think is worth the time.

Pros:

- Visuals are Stunning: This is a common thread with games and videos by 14 Hours Productions, and usually worth the admission alone. The amount of detail they put in every single frame, and the smooth animations are incredible. It really does make top AAA games jealous in that regard.

- Audio is Superb: Every track fits the mood and atmosphere that's going on, and helps keep you immersed in the story the game is trying to convey. It's this unique chiptune style that you don't see very often anymore, and adds so much to an already fun experience. You know it's something to behold when people are purchasing the soundtrack for a free game.

- Clever Writing: The entire game is written in a campfire story style that someone's telling of a woman who went from being a no-name, to an infamous killer. Even when you fail a stage, the dialogue doesn't break that. It's a small detail that I think deserves more praise.

- Interesting Twist on Gameplay: While there's not a ton to it, it's an interesting take that you have to wait until the draw and you manually draw the gun and then aim and shoot, then reholster your gun. Normally on games that are quick draw you simply press the shoot button at the right time. But this one actually pulls you in as the fastest shot. It's extremely satisfying during subsequent playthroughs learning the ticks and getting better at the timing to see just how fast you can do it.


Cons:

- Length: Obviously a smaller complaint as it's a free game, but the story did leave me wanting more. As you can see from my playtime I replayed it through multiple times seeing if there was anything I was missing or if there was something more. Like if you fail or succeed in the final mission, or if you complete the credits a certain way. There wasn't, but as a testament to the writing for making me want more, it's a drawback that the game ends so quickly when you're so invested.

- Couple Bugs: During my multiple playthroughs I'd find a few bugs. If you go back to the Main Menu during almost any section with music, the music stays and then the game just overlaps the rest of the soundtrack. You can stack it too. So like if you go to the Three Gunners, then return to the main menu, then get to the Bar Fight, return ot the main menu, main two I found were the start of the credits, and the Lawman if you fail and kill him before the dialogue box reappears.

And that's about it as Cons go. And if that's all there is for problems, it's a testament to the quality of this game.


Overall this is a fantastic addiction to the 14 Hours Production collection of works. I highly recommend you check out this game (it's Free!) and then other works from them. I've been a fan for 8 years it looks like, so it's fantastic to see that they're still releasing and producing quality content that you can't find anywhere else.

34278251.review: Playing this game takes me back to my days as a wild west gunslinger. Killing without remorse, loving without remorse, eating with remorse. Excellent game, especially for the price!

34271607.review: Yea, I guess I'll recommend it.  It's literally only 4-5 minutes long and has absolutely no replayability, but it's free, and it's written decently enough. 34270591.review:
I didn't expect this game to blow me out of the water.  Reading the reviews most of them said it was short.  Indeed it is short like 10 minutes, but those 10 minutes was amazing that left me wanting more.  For a free game it got me immersed through great storytelling along with the feeling of badassery of the main protagonist shooting.  Although the one glaring problem of this game is how short it is.  This game deserves more praise for being not only free, but the quality of time they put into Dead Horizon.  Looking forward for an expanded game of Bonnie Starr.  

Pros: 
Immersive short story
Great music to listen and feel the tone of the situation
For pixel graphics it is detailed for a free game
It's free!

Cons:
Very very short can play though it muliple times, but extending it to maybe half an hour if you click on everything.
Ending.........did I get him?
Ends too soon.

34267974.review: Very cool story telling. I had a lot of fun for how brief it was. Great Job!

34262877.review: O jogo é bom em questão de "jogabilidade" (pelo que vi, só é usado o mouse) e ainda possui uma história relativamente boa. Mas como nem tudo são flores, ele é bem curto, tanto que você poderia terminar em menos de 20 minutos. Ele não tem tradução, então se você não manja muito de inglês vai ser bem difícil aproveitar o jogo por completo. Recomendo d+.

34257861.review: Haha, That was good lol xD

34251134.review: A nice, fun, and quick game. It has great dialog. Give a play! I highly recommend it!

34241297.review:
A charming 10-minute freebie Visual Novel with a bit of quick-draw rootin’ tootin’ shootin’!

The game involves clicking the screen to progress the storyline. Every so often you’re faced with a gun-slinging shootout where you have to wait for your opponent to draw before you move your mouse cursor to the bottom of the screen to ‘draw’, then your cursor changes to a crosshair and you have to aim and shoot before you get shot yourself, all in one quick movement.

Most of the gunslingers you see in the movies are baddies looking for trouble or good guys sorting them out, but here the protagonist finds herself (yes, it’s a woman), through no real fault of her own, in an escalating situation where her past self-defence killings and increasing notoriety attract more and more trouble, and it comes across as a genuine tale of being trapped in that life. The gameplay and graphics are basic/retro but it gives you food for thought, and the fabulous wild-west language used throughout really immerses you in it.

Not all free games are value for money – your own time also has value – so it needs to be enjoyable to get my thumbs-up, and I can safely say that this is time well spent. The best part for me was after the main game you can go to the menu and select the journal, and for a further 10 minutes of reading you have a brief life history of the protagonist. I found it to be a poignant reminder of how easy (and long) life is these days compared to what people had to go through not so long ago.

You’re told that what makes a killer is not the weapons or the intent, it’s simply that some people enjoy takin’ a life or just don’t care. For some reason it got me thinking about Steam reviewers who would choose to give a charming free game like this a negative review. Go figure.

The Linux version doesn’t work properly at time of writing, but they’re a-fixin’ it, and I’m happy that it’s available at all.

34229792.review: Dead Horizon is a point and click adventure with a very short story, but for free, its a very good game. well made story, unique character models, and a good western feel, but also a little futuristic with some of the characters. Fun game, would play more if there was, a good way to kill time waiting for something.

34227544.review:
大概一共就4个敌人让你打，打完就结束，免费版像是个DEMO，介绍完玩法就结束了。
通关需要5分钟。第一分钟我遇到过卡死BUG，只能重启游戏。
免费，没成就，没卡。没娱乐性。

推荐给想凑评测数量的人。

34216261.review: It's an excellent little visual novel that feels like there's a much bigger world around it, but it doesn't really focus on that aspect. What it does focus on is the protagonist, and her gun. There's not much else to it, and at 10~ minutes, it's not like it's a massive investment of time. If you like westerns, sci-fi or otherwise, I recommend this.

34215101.review: Dead Horizon isn't really a "short and dirty point and click adventure game" so much as a short visual novel with a timing minigame you have to do for every section to progress. The story and characters weren't very interesting, and the writing had way too much "gritty" purple prose that fell flat on me. On the other hand, the art's nice enough and the music was inoffensive. Overall, even at just 10 minutes length and for free, I'd still pass on this because it failed to really make me feel much of anything.

34204729.review: Fun, Short, to the point. Tells a great story which makes you feel awsome when your playing the game

34199392.review: A nice little thought-and-mood piece. A sad, wistful tone and beautiful pixel art. Feels like playing the prologue of a much longer game. Definitely worth the free download and <10 mins.

34198460.review:
Like others have said, this is a very short game with very old-school setting and gameplay. The artwork is better than it would be on an actual 30 year old game. The fact that it is free and takes almost no time to play means there is really no reason to pass it up.

I am so used to watching credits that I did not even know that this has interactive credits until I had finished watching them. I'll have to go back and play it again just to see what that is like. See you in ten minutes.

*UPDATE* Six minutes later (plus the time to write this), I am back to say that I learned more about the game on my second playthrough. Some of the scenes (maybe all?) have little interactions you can make between shooting one fiend and the next. Also, the credits were a fun addition to the game. I have to admit, though, that I did not actually read the credits the second time around because I was too busy shooting everything.

34197872.review: it's meh, not really much of a game, but it's free

34197332.review: Dead Horizon, Short, fun and retro. I definitely enjoyed playing this and recommend anyone interested give it a try!

34195365.review: Short but nice! Would love for this to be made into something bigger.

34187145.review:
Super-super-short, but really, REALLY good.

   Anyone out there thinking about making a small, not-too-ambitious, but ultimately satisfying fifteen minute game could learn SHEDLOADS from this product. A simple concept, well-executed, with just enough "gameplay" to make you feel like you've actually played a "game". Hell, even the end credits have a bit of interactive innovation tossed into 'em. 

   Recommended to absolutely everyone, not least of all 'cause it's free. 'Nuff said.

Verdict: 8.5/10.

34184455.review: Its free and it somehow managed to immerse me in a world in 10 minutes (the length of the game).  Highly recommend!

34183622.review: A ready trigger does not mean the person behind the trigger is ready. Life gives us choices that we're forced into. We may not always make the perfect choices, but we make the right ones for our soul. Your gun never looks back.... Why should you?

34182673.review: A short but engaging experience which lets you share in the life of Bonnie Starr and read the memoir of the gunslinger who trained her. Top notch writing and tension which doesn't overstay its welcome. Just a short visit into an interactive tale with a lot of heart. Certainly worth the time!

34181585.review:
Like many free games I check out on Steam I wasn't expecting a whole lot from Dead Horizon.  Maybe it was the lowered expectations but what I got wasn't a bad game - in fact it was a ton of fun.  You take on the character of Bonnie Starr and her rise as a legendary gunslinger.  Using only your mouse you deal with a handful of various others who want you dead for one reason or another.  Are you fast enough?  

If you're a fan of point and click games, westerns, dueling in general, or supporting games that give a nice old school vibe then I highly recommend giving this a shot.  Even if you're not into any of that - it's free and a tiny download.  At worst you lose a few minutes of your life - at best you get a fun little game that leaves you wanting more.  

Or if you just want to watch it (don't, just try it!): https://youtu.be/HZjw7RFrbVI

34181430.review: Enjoyable as all hell, for the ten minutes that it lasted.

34181281.review: Great way to spend 10 minutes! The dialogue was witty, the colors were vibrant, the characters were simple yet well done. I got a kick out of the interactive credits. Definitely worth a couple of playthroughs.

34180657.review:
It's... why is it so short? This is really good! All 5 fucking minutes were awesome. 

Graphics: Very pleasant pixel art. Nothing to complain about, just good.

Story: Story is awesome! I wish there were more of it though. You play as Starr, a young woman in the Wild West. You shoot a couple guys and then the credits roll. 

Gameplay: You put your cursor on the bottom of the screen to pull/put away your gun and click to shoot. That's it, but it works pretty well. 

You may notice how short this review is; and if you play the game you'll know why. There's barely a goddamn game. This is essentially a demo. Perhaps the DLC has a real game in it, but I'm not paying 5$. 

It's free and it's good so just play it.

34180287.review: Stunning art, catchy music, and good writing, all wrapped in an interesting setting. I especially enjoyed how fluid the gun drawing felt. It might only be 5 minutes long, but for the price, its worth it!

34179950.review: The game is real short but its free and its a fun. I'd recommend it if you've ever played the old school click shooters. Solid job to the developers. Hopefully they either add to this or make more. Maybe add a mode where you don't have a story just duels that get progressivley get harder? Either way I liked it.
